summary: Email correspondence between U.S. prosecutors working on the Jeffrey Epstein investigation and a U.S. Department of Justice attaché at the U.S. Embassy in London. The prosecutors request a call to discuss logistical questions, noting recent UK news about FBI/DOJ interest in Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email states the prosecutors are working on the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of recent UK news regarding FBI/DOJ interest.

connections.description: The document references UK news about FBI/DOJ interest in Prince Andrew in the context of the Epstein investigation, implying an association under investigation.

events.title: Prosecutors request coordination call
events.description: U.S. prosecutors from the Southern District of New York working on the Epstein investigation email a DOJ attaché in London to schedule a call for logistical coordination.

locations: United States Embassy, 33 Nine Elms Lane, London SW11, UK
keyFacts: U.S. prosecutors were actively working on the Jeffrey Epstein investigation as of December 2019.
The prosecutors sought logistical coordination with a DOJ official at the U.S. Embassy in London.
Recent UK news at the time reported FBI/DOJ interest in Prince Andrew in connection with the Epstein case.
The communication shows international coordination efforts in the Epstein investigation.
